channel.title: Postmile on Roadsign Pictures
channel.description: Recent content in Postmile on Roadsign Pictures

item.title: US-6 East - Ely
item.description: Entering Ely on US-6 west. Elevation 6435 Feet. Ely is the county seat of White Pine County. A US-6 postmile is in the background of the photo.

item.title: NV-318 North - White Pine County Line
item.description: White Pine County Line on NV-318 North. The Nevada postmile markers for White Pine County and Nye County are at the bottom of the sign post.

item.title: US-93 North - Lincoln County
item.description: Lincoln County Line on US-93 north.

item.title: Begin NV-172 West
item.description: Begin NV-172 west at the Hoover Dam Security Checkpoint. Postmile 1.35.

item.title: NV-173 South - Mile 1
item.description: Mile 1 in Clark County on NV-173 south

item.title: NV-439 North - Mile 1
item.description: Storey County Mile 1 on NV-439 North. This type of postmile sign is being rolled out across Nevada. The new style are larger and have the route shield in it.

item.title: US-95 North Approaching I-80
item.description: US-95 north approaching I-80. Use I-80 East/US-95 North to Lovelock; use I-80 West/Alt. US-95 South to Reno. Turn left to enter the Rest Area. Notice the post mile marker at the base of the sign.

item.title: NV-208 North Approaching Alt. US-95
item.description: NV-208 north approaching Alt. US-95 north in Yerrington. Below the Alt. US-95 shield is a Nevada post mile marker. Nevada state and US highways do not have traditional mile markers, but instead have these post mile markers. The mileage on these markers reset at each county line. The top line is the route type, in this case SR (State Route). The next line is the two character county abbreviation - LY for Lyon County.

item.title: US-395 South - Postmile
item.description: California Postmile on US-395 South at the Oregon-California border. This postmile is attached to the California welcome sign. The number at the top refers to the route (US-395). The second line is the county abbreviation (Modoc County), and the bottom number is the mile from the previous county or state line. In this case 61.56 miles from the Lassen/Modoc County Line.
